venue.address_2: 1.5 miles south of Rt. 130 on Rt. 13
venue.name: Andres Institute of Art

item.description:
Here's what it's all about; As a result of the collective effort from these gifted artists, we now have over 50 thought-provoking original works of art nestled along walking trails all over the mountain in our 140 acre sculpture park. Our park contains miles of wooded trails, beautiful vistas, and peaceful settings. It is the combination of art and nature that makes a visit to Andres Institute of Art a unique and memorable occasion. I love this place!

It is a small mountain,  so there are short upgrades   There are many sculptures scattered along the trails.  We will be stopping and viewing each one....bring your cameras!  Basically a leisurely hike.   Approximately, two hours and 3 miles. With the large group it will probably take 3 plus hours.   Someone had mentioned going to Parker's Maple Barn, so that's a possibilty.

group.name: Northern Central MA, Southern NH Hiking Group

item.name: Andres Institute of Art
